Reviews.Title: “Tradeoffs, but a winner!”
Reviews.Author: marine6569
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night for the Jimmy Buffett concert. The good: Location in the West End of Downtown Dallas (we overlooked the amazing Dallas World Aquarium, and it is within 4 blocks of many restaurants and attractions). The Dart light rail train is within 3 blocks. Parking is only $5 self park. The decor is nice. Digital TV channels. The hot breakfast is free and very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. Need to know: You are downtown and can hear street noise. You can also hear the sounds of water running in adjacent rooms. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. The rate was excellent for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient place to stay for AAC”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and quiet on our side. Breakfast was great! The side on the West End party side is noisy.

Reviews.Title: “outdated, not clean, loud”
Reviews.Author: PeteCHS
Reviews.Content: good location BUT outdated means dirty furniture, carpets etc. If people upstairs use the bathroom you think that your bathroom is exploding. Seriously as long as somebody else uses the bathroom or water you will not be able to sleep. Normally I am easy going and dont need to stay in luxury hotels. just clean and quiet. This hotel fails in both points. every Motel 6 is better

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LeeAnn325
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to the American Airlines Center in Dallas. After reading some of the reviews for this hotel I was hesitant to book it. I am glad I did. We were in town for a Dallas Mavericks game and also wanted to visit the West End. This hotel is located in the West End and is about 8 blocks from the AAC. We were able tp park our car and walk wherever we wanted to go. The Dallas Aquarium is practically across the street. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are not 5 star but decent and clean. Valet parking is $22 but there is a public lot directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: shelman
Reviews.Content: The room was fine. The front desk staff disappeared frequently. When I went to check out, I had to use the phone at the front desk to get an attendant. The valet was also not easily found.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, weak coffee, but a great location for downtown Big D”
Reviews.Author: LesDye
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, I found my room preferences were ignored, but the front deck clerk fixed that. Nice TV, way-loud A.C. Breakfast: below the average for this type of hotel. It was a bit odd that the front desk staff allowed a cabbie to hang out by the elevator, asking anyone with a suitcase this morning: "need a ride to the airport?" It's bad enough to be badgered on the streets but I expect this NOT to happen in my hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel that is in awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: Montgomrie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were full big enough to comfortably house three guys on decent terms with each other. There was no morning room service, which was a bit of a letdown, but ignorable. They serve a lower-middle-of-the-road breakfast in the morning. The hotel staff wasn't able to help find much of anything near the hotel--restaurants, stuff to do and the like--but, they were friendly and accommodating. This hotel's greatest asset has nothing to do with the hotel itself, actually, it's a simple matter of location. They're immediately south of the Dallas World Aquarium, a bit further south of McKinney Avenue, just west of the train station, and a stone's throw east of The House of the Blues. For the price, I didn't see any other hotels that were even remotely comparable. In short, this isn't the place to stay if you're only going to be here one night. But if you plan on sticking around and seeing a thing or two, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Lucked out big time.”
Reviews.Author: LRob11
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel purely on the price, about $120/night compared with others in he downtown area. I had never been to Dallas and didn't know the city well so I was pleasantly surprised that the hotel was so centrally located and near restaurants and attractions. As soon as I pulled in I was greeted by a very pleasant valet who became my favorite person all weekend (I stayed thurs-sun). He gave me great tips for restaurants and always had a big smile for me. The best part was that he kept my car right near the door in the garage so I could easily come and go, grab stuff from my car and know that someone was always watching it. That was huge for me. The rooms were a good size, not very fancy, but clean. The heater/AC unit was obnoxiously loud at night so I finally figured out how to turn it off so it wouldn't wake me up. The breakfast offering was decent, yogurt, eggs, waffles etc. The excercise room had good equipment. The pool looked nice, although it was way too cold to use. All in all, it was a great value and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: ranhorn
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had an enjoyable time at this hotel. While it is not the nicest place we've ever stayed, it is certainly not the worst. Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful. The $5 parking garage across the street was very convenient and a much better deal than the $22 valet at the hotel. Restaurants were close by and the location was very convenient to DART and the 6th Floor Museum. We would stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was clean service was good, just a few problems that will keep me from going back”
Reviews.Author: Emailrobert
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, but we stayed on 10th floor and it took 4-5 minutes for hot water to get to tub, toilet wouldn't flush contents. Air conditioner was old style mounted in window. Took me a few minutes to find the light switch that powered the ac

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Good location”
Reviews.Author: cincytravelerOhio
Reviews.Content: We were with a wedding group and the wedding was just around the corner. Our first time in Dallas and we could walk to Dealey Plaza and the 6th floor museum. Restaurants nearby and easy on and off the highway. Clean room and decent breakfast for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Loud even up high”
Reviews.Author: vatali
Reviews.Content: I had a 6th floor room facing the parking lot. The lights in that lot are on all night, and eaisly shine through the window if you do not have the shades closed. The room itself was small, and reminded me of a New York City room. The noise from the traffic below could be heard at all hours. That being said, the breakfast was very well done, and the food was replaced quickly when empty. The lobby was presented nicely, although there could have been more staff on hand when I checked in. There were several people in line, and only 1 staff person doing teh work. The area was safe and in walking distance of many resturants.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service I've Ever Had!”
Reviews.Author: Serenidad58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in downtown Dallas, and as our venue was literally around the corner from Springhill Suites they recommended this hotel to us for getting a block of rooms for our guests. We looked around at hotels in the area and they had the best rates and the rooms seemed nice so we booked 20+ rooms for our guests that weekend. Let me first state the positives of the hotel: the rooms were clean and a decent size. The pool was nice, and the location is excellent for being close to everything downtown. That being said, I have NEVER had a worse experience with a hotel in my life (considering my personality is more on the relaxed, go-with-the-flow side it takes a lot for me to get irked)! We set the block of rooms up several months before the wedding, so I was not anticipating any problems, but when I went to check into the hotel a few days before the wedding they informed me they had overbooked the hotel accidentally and didn't have a room for me. Needless to say I was angry - I am the bride of the wedding for goodness sake! And what is the point in setting up a block of rooms in advance if you are going to bump guests!? They also said that knowing it was my wedding, they meant to keep a room for me and bump guests of mine but they got confused when someone checked in with my last name (well... hello! It's a wedding for goodness sake lol) and they gave the room they were holding for me to my parents. Anyways, I was very upset that I wouldn't be able to stay in the same hotel as my guests. The best they could offer was to book me at a hotel several blocks away that had rooms available. That hotel was more expensive and they tried to tell me that they would only pay for the price difference the first night and the other 2 nights were up to me. I had to argue with the manager for some time for them to agree to pay the price difference for the entire time! I don't think that is unreasonable at all, and was frankly appalled that they were trying to make me pay for their mistake! Then I learned the next day that Springhill had also bumped my in-laws to the hotel down the road and were refusing to pay ANY of the price difference for them! I had to go back to Springhill Suites and argue AGAIN with the manager for them to pay the difference! My final complaint was that we had called ahead about 2 weeks before and asked to book a conference room one night for part of the bachelorette party. Everything seemed fine and then the night of the party we went to get the keys to the room and they said they had no record of us booking it and there was nothing they could do. I had to argue with them again! And finally I asked for the manager - I think by this point he was scared to argue with me again lol! So they let us use the room, but it was way too much hassle! Especially when we had booked it in advance. All in all I think this hotel is ok for someone who is not part of a large party. If you are planning on getting married in the area (we were married in the Starlight Room) and want to book a hotel for you and your guests I would STRONGLY recommend going to a different hotel. This might have been a fluke, but I wouldn't take the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, dodgy location”
Reviews.Author: Novajim2010
Reviews.Content: As you expect from Marriott's Springhill Suites, good rooms, reasonably clean and an average breakfast buffet. Close to Market Street and some decent restaurants, but heading south of Lamar after 3pm is not for the faint of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel...awesome location”
Reviews.Author: AwesomeFashionista
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in Sept. The parking is across the street from the hotel. The hotel was VERY CLEAN, very nice helpful staff, awesome location, near many restaurants, big spacious rooms, hotel shuttle bus...If your visiting the aquarium u can practically see it when you walk out the front door and it's right across the street. You also have plenty of other museums surrounding you!!! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: CarolLeeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a nice location and is your basic Marriot.. My room was in good condition, not dirty, not beat up etc. Breakfast was OK, your basic Springhill breakfast. Lots of good resturants to walk too. Front desk staff was always very helpful "Wifi" is BAD! The only place it worked in my suite was at the desk by the door and even then signal strength was "low' Luckily there was a wired connection, but it meant I could not use my IPAD at all! BOO! Also, while it has a kitchentte there are not plates, utinsels etc.. maybe you can get them but at other Springhills I have stayed in they were waiting on me! Valet parking is ther real problem! First it's $22 which is probably reasonable for a big city, but a little steep for a "value" chain. Second, it appears they park the cars miles away and only have ONE valet. Waits were VERY long for the car, just not acceptable for a $22 "fee". Service gets a poor rating because of this. Hard to recommend this one, but it's not bad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is tired and beat up. Front Desk personnel not very competent”
Reviews.Author: mow11
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for a tournament the past three years. What was a relatively nice hotel, is now a VERY tired and not clean property. Furniture in rooms are stained and beat up as are carpets. Bathroom is okay, but areas where floor meets wall in rooms are dusty and dirty. Complimentary breakfast is above average. Free internet in room is good. Great location, but loud, live music from the West End Restaurants bothered some of the people in our group. Also had incident where another guest was given a key to my room. They evidently took it back to front desk and then were sent back up to my room with a hotel employee who used a master key to walk in my room. Didn't realize it until that happened that the security bar that I thought I had latched on my door was broken! Hotel front desk apologized when I complained and did replace the security latch by the time I came back the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off”
Reviews.Author: cjg12324
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on June 5th. The hotel made a mistake and check someone else in our room. That person took all of our electronic equipment including our computer, IPAD, Ipod etc. The hotel has not made good on replacing our stolen items. I am a Marriot Gold member but and switching to Hilton Honors based this horrible expirience. This hotel is run by folks that don't give a damn.

Reviews.Title: “High Crime Area”
Reviews.Author: TxMarky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a high crime area. We had our vehicle valet parked for $24 and we were assured that it would be safe in a covered garage with a security guard. Our vehicle was broken into and management will not pay for any damages or items stolen. We are out over $1,000. In addition this hotel is run down.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and surprising.”
Reviews.Author: sarajane40
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you are going to a concert at House of Blues or any other attraction in the area. Staff is very nice. Rooms smell good and are very clean. No problem with parking. Felt very safe and secure. The breakfast was good and had a nice selection. Good and easy wifi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: lumberjack48
Reviews.Content: This Mariott brand hotel is perfectly located to everything downtown Dallas, especially the West End of Dallas. Easy to get to and from and in the middle of everything. The rooms are large, clean , and modern. You can park across the street for $5.00 per day or have the valet park it for $22 per day. The hospitality/breakfast room is huge. The breakfast is current mariott fare, however, there is a managers reception I believe on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday that is excellant and the person in charge of it named Kelly is awesome. The Texas pale ale is also very good. There is only one ding for this hotel. If you are not a very sound sleeper, stay away from the outside floor that borders the street unless you are on a high floor. The trucks and bises go all night. I WILL stay there again soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Aquarium Visit”
Reviews.Author: Rod_Houston
Reviews.Content: The Springhill Suites in downtown Dallas is a great place to stay for a family traveling with young children. The location of the hotel is perfect if your plans include a trip to the Dallas World Aquarium as the hotel is literally across the street. The location is also great for a visit to Dealey Plaza and the Dallas Zoo. Dealey plaza is well within walking distance (10 minutes tops) and the Zoo is accessible by the Dallas light rail system which has a stop just a few blocks from the hotel. In addition to the tourist spots there are also a fair number of dining options around the hotel. The suites were large which was great for the kids and the staff very friendly. Breakfast was above average and the beds comfortable. The only negatives are parking is a bit pricey at $22 per night, the sidewalks are very narrow in spots so using a stroller to travel can be a bit tricky and since the hotel is in downtown it can seem a bit dicey at times as you will see a fair number of homeless people and other interesting characters (especially at the train stop). However, never once did we feel unsafe and there was always a heavy police presence in the area. Overall a nice hotel and somewhere weâ€™d stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out if you valet! BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: dulpitt
Reviews.Content: They steal stuff out of your car! Take your kids items then take no responsibility for their employees actions! It may seem like you are getting a good deal but you may have to consider stolen items into the cost of your stay!

Reviews.Title: “"WANNA BE HIGH CLASS HOTEL" EXPENSIVE N ABSOLUTLY HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Linda44033
Reviews.Content: I usually dont usually take the time for writing reviews since i don't have the time for it. nevertheless, this is such an specific case i have to. I want you to know what i terrible mistake i made by chosing this hotel. As soon as i got there they could not find my reservation in the system and made me buy a bigger more expensive room. This girl i dont wanna mention her name (the only at the hotel on that sunday night) had a very bad atitude. The hotel was empty so i parked my car outside at the door. It wasnt valet, they kept the key and still charged me an extra 25 for that. I arrived around 11 at night and left at 6 next morning, so my car was exactly where i left it. The room costed me around 220 plus taxes and valet costed me around almost $300. The room was very old. The air conditioning/heater had to be turned off cuz of the loud noise it made I couldnt sleep. Everything and all the equipments are very old. The location is very unaccessible and horrible. Im not very familiar with Dallas but that location seemed dangerous to me. the breakfast is very deceiving also. PLEASE DONT GO THERE! The price is really not worth it. they are absolutely insane to have prices like that for such a low quality and bad services. Honestly if you stay at Motel 6 it will feel more luxurious than that! I have originally chosen to stay there cuz of the price, i thought it should be good for that price! I was very wrong! I went next night to the Crowne Plaza and had a blast! I was very amazed with the friendly stuff, great food, great location and FREE accessible parking right in front of the elevators! All of that for half of the price! New comfortable rooms i felt in heaven after the horrible time i had at the Springhill Suites. I have to go back to Dallas several more times and will never ever go back to the Springhill Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - just as we expected”
Reviews.Author: MeCo0811
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, easy to get in and out of, and was within a couple of blocks of the House of Blues (our main destination for the evening). Was just what we expected for the price. Parking could have been improved, but breakfast was good and staff was helpful. Will stay here again next time we're going to a concert!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and lovely staff but bad area”
Reviews.Author: donnalovescheese
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night during the state fair. The absolute stand out thing about this hotel was the staff. They were all friendly, helpful and really made our stay here. The room was large and clean. A pretty standard suite, nothing special but great value for money. Breakfast offered a good selection. The only thing we didn't like about this hotel was the area. We had booked thinking we could walk to restaurants in the West End district but the area directly around this hotel did not feel safe. It was dark and deserted apart from a couple of homeless people and 2 guys we saw obviously selling drugs. I would recommend using taxis if staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Area”
Reviews.Author: bgregoryWichitaKs
Reviews.Content: The hotel was acceptable. The area was very dicey. Lots of homeless, the area around DART (Dallas area rapid transit) was full of folks that looked like they had just been released from the pen. There were no police foot patrols, and frankly, I would not have walked around without a gun. Dallas, if you want this area to prosper, increase your police presence, and lighting. The hotel was basic and fine, I was kept awake all night by the traffic. Make sure to ask for a room on the quiet side if you decide to stay here. I would not recommend walking around the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE!!!! Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: goldenjava
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Spinghill Suites for the second year in a row when we go to Dallas for the Razorback vs Texas A& M game at the Cowboy Stadium in Arlington, TX. This past Saturday , October 9, 2009, we had arrived at the Stadium (about half an hour away from hotel with no traffic) with our party and parked the coach for our tailgate when my husband and I realized that we had left our football tickets at the hotel. There were four football games going on in Dallas area on the same day and traffic was horrendous. After discovering we had left our tickets back at the hotel, I made one phone call to the front desk and spoke with someone named Kevin. I explained our predicament and told him where my ticktets were located and if they can arrange for a hotel car or cab to bring our tickets to us for a fee. Kevin put me on hold for about a couple of mintues, came back on the phone, took down all the details from me and said, "We'll take care of it". I was sooooo relieved!! They met us at the Walgreens a block and a half from the stadium about 45 mintues later with tickets in hand, no questions aksed, no fee requested. We tipped the driver, Sergio for his help and he also said, "No, you don't need to do that." We insisted! We will be writing a very appreciative thank you letter to the hotel and corporate offices of Marriott. Will definitley return. This usually happens at the 5 -6 star hotel and the Springhill Suites is definitely of the same status, in my opinion!!!! Good breakfast, comfortable and big rooms, friendly valet and front desk, EXCELLENT SERVICE, EXCELLENT HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mad as hell”
Reviews.Author: EastTexasPanther
Reviews.Content: I had trouble finding my way to the hotel. When I called for directions, the person named Matt that answered the phone gave me the wrong directions. Real funny joke.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_2wn
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this hotel! The room we had (a double) was well-appointed, and very comfortable. Check in took ages due to the hotel being so full and people apparently extending their stay, but it was all worked out in the end. There's a small reception in the early evening, with beer/wine and snacks which is a great way to mingle with other guests. Breakfast the next morning was extensive, and staff we met were friendly and efficient. Only parking available is valet, which costs about $20 a day with tax, and although we had no problems I can see how they can be backed up at peak times. The hotel is literally surrounded by parking lots, so if we stayed here again then I think we would just park across the street (which was about $6 for all day).

Reviews.Title: “A Low Quality Springhill Suites”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: Some Springhill Suites are brand new, state of the art, and in a higher quality then the price you pay for them. This is not one of them. This one is old. The rooms feel ancient and outdated. The tv is old. The parking is expensive and only valet is offered. The office staff was pretty nice during my stay here and the location makes it the only real major chain hotel in the west end district. It is a great location literally next to the food/store offerings the west end has.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and quiet”
Reviews.Author: AGC2001
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very nice, clean, quiet, and affordable. Will definitely stay at this hotel again. The breakfast bar was good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: rspence1270
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Clean, hotel next to West End. Vanessa at the front desk was awesome. I can't say enough nice things about her! I rated sleep quality a little lower. Out room was second floor above the busy street intersection, and we were close to the elevator. So, we could hear all the loud cars, motorcycles, people out late partying on the streets. We could also hear everyone who came off the elevator. I can't really fault the hotel for that.

Reviews.Title: “The frontdesk clerk had a bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: sept2609
Reviews.Content: I work at a Marriot and I don't know of any Marriot having any unprofessional employees. IThe front desk clerk, Kevin, was rude towards my husband and I. He would watch over us like a hawk. I don't appreciate someone looking over me when there's no reason to. He rolled his eyes and huffed when my husband asks for some laundry soap. He did not have a sense of humor at all. That would make any guest not come back.

Reviews.Title: “difficult circumstances”
Reviews.Author: freddiejunior
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately a hotel guest had an incident in one of the rooms on the 6th floor which led to the sprinkler system kicking in and flooding numerous rooms on the 6th/5th and 4th floors.The hotel team reacted quckly and professionally and tried to give all guests the best service possible.The breakfast is great sets you up for the day.As a hotelthe location is firstclass walking distance to Dealey Plaza,American Airlines Center and Art Museum. Bars and restaurants in the area are very good.I would certainly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great location and overall service but a few bumps”
Reviews.Author: Lilly_Fox
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for 2 rooms beginning December 31 for 3 nights that we made six or seven weeks in advance. We were in town for a football game and were excited because we were going to take advantage of many of the Downtown activities for New Years Eve. When we arrived at the hotel at 7:30pm, they didn't have our rooms and walked us to a Springhill Suites 6-7 miles away on Loop 12. While they paid for our rooms that night, we didn't get to attend any of the NYE activities because we didn't want to fight the traffic or deal with parking and the NYE drunks. We checked into the hotel again the next morning and our rooms weren't ready. We went out and about and by the time we checked in, there wasn't a king bed room available as we had requested. We also didn't realize till check out, but when they had re-instated our rooms, they put the rate in wrong. The location of the hotel is GREAT as are most of the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. They recommeded several places to go that turned out to be excelled. We used valet during our stay and it seemed to be constantly backed up. When we returned to the hotel the last night there after our football game, we left a leather coat and hat in the car. When we returned home, we realized we didn't have either one. From both our memories and our pictures, the only time it could have been taken was from the car that night. I called the hotel a couple of times and left messages for Lost and Found but never recieved a call back. We suspect the valet didn't lock the door and somebody wandered through the parking lot checking for unlocked cars. We realize we shouldn't have left anything in the car but locking the car should be a basic requirement for valet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Quiet w/ outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: borderlandbarrister
Reviews.Content: I was here on business. The staff is outstanding, especially the blonde front-desk manager. They gave me rides to where I needed to go and really went out of their way to make me feel comfortable. The housekeeper was very cordial (although she only spoke Spanish, but it gave me an excuse to practice my Spanish). Room was very clean, they honored my last minute request for a top floor room and they held my bags on the last day and took me to the train depot. Hotel is not far from several restaurants, although the location is a bit questionable.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but probably won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: MajorHurdle
Reviews.Content: Generally acceptable... Good breakfast, clean room, good bed... Being a business traveler, I am interested in how well the property suits the business traveler. Here's where they failed. The staff seems untrained or unsupervised. When I arrived, I was greeted with a ""Hey,Hey,Hey" and thy weren't particularly helpful. The room desk chair is to short for the desk making it unusable. The neighborhood is very noisy... I was kept awake for two nights by outdoor rock and roll bands. If you are here to party, probably a good value. Find another place if you are here to work.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Room in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: H2ORat
Reviews.Content: Came to Dallas to see a couple of Texas Ranger Baseball games with two other 50+ adult friends. The area is far from the ballfield in Arlington but close to most of the nightlife and restaurants that Dallas has to offer. The pool is small and the gym is marginal, but the amount of space in the suite made up for these small concerns. We paid $159/ night which was about $30.00 more then the other hotels offering a single room. The air conditioner worked well enough to cool the entire room. Housekeeping wasn't exceptional, but adequate. Staff was friendly and helpful. The included breakfast was also very good. If I returned to Dallas, I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: OLDTHINGS
Reviews.Content: Went last weekend for a getaway trip. Everything was fine with our stay. This is our 3rd stay at West End Springhill. Staff was very helpful. Convenient to several restaurants. The Dallas World Aquarium is a short block away and definitely worth a visit. We ate at Landry's and RJ, enjoyed both, however ate at Hoffbrau Steak House and I would not recommend, poor service and food. You can take the rail and travel around. The only thing I dislike about the west end as there are just no places for ladies to shop. Wish they would get some stores in area..

Reviews.Title: “Dark, moist and a little bit scary.”
Reviews.Author: pickyab0uth0tels
Reviews.Content: I am surprised how high this hotel is ranked. I found the staff to be rude and distracted. During two different conversations with two different front desk employees, I was asking a simple question and they anwsered the phone while I was talking! The air conditoner simply made the room more humid and everything felt damp. The rooms are down long, poorly lit, and ziz-zaging hallways that made me (a female) worry what was lurking behind the next turn. I did appreciate free wifi and decent breakfast. It was also very quiet. This hotel is not up to Marriott standards, and I don't recommend it unless you're desperate for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay”
Reviews.Author: jetsetmd
Reviews.Content: I travel quite frequently for business and I have stayed at my fair share of hotels and this was by far one of the worst experiences I've had. I stay at Marriott's as much as possible because I am a member of their rewards program and there arent very many hotel choices in downtown Dallas. I was scheduled to be in Dallas for two weeks (which would earn me alot of nights toward elite status and points) and I chose this Springhill Suites because a few coworkers had stayed here and had decent experiences, so I may just have been unlucky but I will never return to this hotel. I checked in Sunday evening and I didn't find the staff to be particularly friendly. They didn't do anything to acknowledge my Gold status with Marriott. I was given a room on the 3rd floor (I generally prefer higher floor rooms) and upon arriving in my room I found a coffee pot with brewed coffee in it covered in a layer of mold. I understand that things like this happen sometimes so I called down to the front desk to politely ask if something could be done about it. The woman informed me that she would send someone up to swap out the pot so I said that was fine and was promptly told "i mean is there something else you want me to do about it?" I thought that was pretty rude and was also surprised that I received no apology at all. The maintenance man who came to swap it out was very apologetic and promised to show it to housekeeping so they could be made aware. That made me feel a little bit better so I settled into my room for the night. I found the heating/air conditioning unit to be extremely loud and it blew hot air directly onto the bed. (I'm a light sleeper) I tried to turn it off, figuring that I could sleep with it off all night and I understand that this is not in the staff's control. At about 11:30pm the city began power washing the sidewalks right outside of the hotel. I went down to the front desk because it was impossible to sleep, to see if I could possibly be moved to a higher floor or the other side of the building. I hate complaining and being an inconvenience but I could not sleep. When I went to the front desk to ask if they knew what was going on and if they knew how long it was going to last. They handed me ear plugs and acted surprised when I wanted to switch rooms. They moved my room which I appreciated but I still had a very hard time sleeping due to the air conditioning unit and I checked out the next morning and moved to the Magnolia. I will NEVER stay at this hotel again and atleast one of my coworkers has since had a similar experience feeling that the staff was rude at check-in. I was very disappointed in the quailty of this Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one week recently on a business trip. The hotel is located in the West End of Dallas, which is less impressive than it was 5-10 years ago. However, the location is still near several restaurants (the ones that haven't closed - a sign of the economic times and the other areas of downtown Dallas that are 'up-and-coming') and is within walking distance of most downtown buildings (probably between half a mile and one mile of most of downtown). The hotel is clean, but seems a little older. When you exit the elevator, instead of carpet you are greeted with older tile which transitions to carpet. Also, there were minor issues with my bathroom (e.g., chipped tiles, water temperature control not functioning well as it was mostly scolding hot, and only one light which did not extend into the shower very well - I felt like I was showering in the dark). The room was spacious, with one (older) TV and couch. The internet is free (and fast) and the refridgerator was chilled and ready to be used. There is a nearby CVS that you can use to stock up on items. My room did not have a view, but the room was quiet. I understand that the other side of the hotel may have some views of downtown, but I was warned (by colleagues) that birds from the nearby Acquarium make noises in the early morning. All in all, this is not a bad hotel (for a government rate), but other hotels in the area (if you can get a good price), are probably nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Davetjones
Reviews.Content: Spent 9 nights at Springhill and found hotel to be in a cracking location. All the staff were a joy. My son & I were Dallas to attend 3 Dallas Stars Ice Hockey games & also pick up a Dallas Mavericks basketball game so location was perfect for American Airlines Centre. Used car park acroos the street as only $8 per day so cheaper then valet parking at hotel. Loads of nearby restaurants and bars. If you get chance take a trip up McKinney...can highly recommend Frankies Sports Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location; even better service”
Reviews.Author: TimmyB1957
Reviews.Content: First, a disclaimer: our daughter works for a Marriott property, so we stay for an extremely discounted price that is not available to the general public. With that in mind, I rate all hotels as if I had paid what appears to be the going, discounted rate that others paid. We stayed in this hotel for two nights over spring break. We had two sights we had to see: obviously, Dealey Plaza was one. The other was the Museum of Art, which was hosting the King Tut exhibition. This hotel was three blocks from one, a half-mile to the other. Very convenient location. Also, you are right off the highway, with easy access to just about anywhere. When you first arrive, you will probably do what I did: cruise right past the place where you are supposed to enter. There is a cut-out in the building, about the width of toaster, where you are supposed to pull in to register! I would think it was just me, but I watched others go right past it when they arrived also. They have valet parking, with full in-and-out, for about $20 / day. However, across the street and down one block is a six-level ramp, with parking for $5 per day. As a matter of fact, the first day we got into the ramp before 10AM and it was only $2.50 for the day. Can't beat that in a large city. We arrived early, and they found a room for us right away; even watched the car for us while we went up to the room to drop off our bags. From beginning to end, the staff was always looking out for us, asking if we needed anything, offering advice on which restaurants were great, which ones were overpriced, where the great shopping was, etc. Again, we didn't feel as though we were in a large city hotel. I have stayed downtown in many large cities and was expecting the small, cramped room, which is the norm. On the contrary, the room was huge, with a full work area, mini-kitchen, good sleeping area, and a wonderful view of the great Dallas architecture. Very clean and the HVAC system allowed you to run the fan continuously, which we like because it blocks out the hallway noise. Amenities were OK; the pool was small, no spa to sit in. The exercise room was basic, but it did have a couple of fabulous new treadmills with built in flat-screen TV's. They did have two computers for free web-access for those of us who don't like to lug around our laptops with us. Breakfast was very good. I love the self-made waffle machine, and this one was cool because, instead of being round, it came out Texas-shaped! Nice touch. Overall, great location, convenient to downtown, fabulous service. In a heartbeat, I would recommend this place to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel with great amenities, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: PAmusicmom
Reviews.Content: good breakfast in the morning, and a great business center, free computer use, staff was knowledgeable and friendly. walking distance to the west end and the house of blues.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Experience”
Reviews.Author: BobNOVA
Reviews.Content: First off - I need to say that Marriott is my chain of choice, and this stay won't change that decision - I might even choose this property again if in downtown Dallas. Four things bothered me: - The lady that checked me in was snotty and didn't acknowledge my Marriott Elite status (protocol for any chain). - AC/Heater. I asked the from desk to have maintenance look at it twice because the thermostat wasn't working correctly - it was either roasting hot or ice cold. Maintenance did look at the unit, but it wasn't fixed during my stay. - Valet parking is ridiculous at $18 per night. Take my advice and pay the $6 to park across the street. True there's no in/out privlege, but you're in the west end and can walk or train anywhere downtown. - The oatmeal at breakfast was too soupy for my taste. I know this is really picky, but all the other Marriott's have the right oatmeal mixing ration figured out. Pluses: - Location - Price - Clean

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a group”
Reviews.Author: doctorjr
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Dallas for a conference with a group which included several college students on a budget. We booked the Springhill Suites for the amenities it offered, such as the complimentary breakfast and free wireless in the rooms. We were very pleased with our stay and the location of the hotel. Our rooms were large with the extra suite area, so we were able to sleep 3 in a room comfortably. The rooms were clean and the beds quite comfortable (although I can't vouch for the sofa bed, since I didn't sleep on it). The hot breakfast was pretty standard, but a definite plus for the group in trying to save a few pennies. We liked the Texas shaped waffles! The hotel had karaoke the night we arrived, and it seemed like everyone was having fun, but it ended before we could get downstairs to it. The hotel lobby is quite small, but adequate, and the hotel staff were helpful for the most part. I did have problems after I returned home with a hotel clerk in trying to get a copy of my receipt showing my paid bill, but she eventually helped me. We relied upon the conference shuttle and the DART station nearby for transportation, so it was pretty convenient to get wherever we wanted to go. We also liked being able to walk to all the restaurants in the West End at night. There were many to choose from, and the students thought the location of our hotel was great. The Dallas Aquarium is practically at the back door of the hotel, and the JFK sites are close by, as well as restaurants like the House of Blues and Spaghetti Warehouse. Others at the conference who were staying in the hotels by the interstate were jealous of all the restaurants and attractions that were in walking distance of our hotel! Overall, it was a good experience and a great value for a group.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate”
Reviews.Author: OLDTHINGS
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent! This was our second stay at the hotel. The most efficient hotel, the staff I have encountered go out of their way to help you. Located in the west end, close to Dallas World Aquarium, and restaurants, Dealey Plaza where JFK was shot. Don't hesitate to stay at this hotel if your going to west end historical area!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: theskeemer
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond guy who has spent a considerable amount of time staying at Hilton properties in Dallas. Despite my Hilton status, I chose to spend two months at this Marriott property simply because of the location. Most hotels around Dallas are off the freeway someplace. And the hotels Downtown are Downtown, which is very boring, and slightly scary at night. This hotel is perfect, within walking distance of Downtown, but located in the West End which a nice area filled with restaurants, and bars. My family spent about 3 weeks out here with me and they got season passes to the Dallas World Aquarium, which is literally across the street. They went there every day and loved it. The hotel staff is great to, they treated us like part of the family. If I have to come back to Dallas again, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service despite some hiccups”
Reviews.Author: mgsooner
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in fairly good condition but is in need of some updating. There is some paint peeling here and there, and the rooms have a bit of a dated feel to them. Also, the air conditioners in the rooms are quite loud. We're not the type to be bothered easily by that type of thing, but light sleepers would have problems. There was an issue with the valet parking the first evening we were there. We came down to get our car to go to a show, and they had a new employee working the valet who could not get the door open to the parking garage to get our car out. We waited for over 20 minutes, and had finally told the front desk attendant to just call us a cab because we had somewhere that we needed to be. As we were walking outside, finally here came our car. To their credit, they were very apologetic, and they even refunded me the cost of the valet parking fee, which was superb. The best thing about this hotel is the service. Everyone I encountered was extremely, go out of their way nice. I called the front desk fairly late one night to inquire about any restaurants that delivered food at that hour, and not only did the woman give me the name of a place, she had a menu sent up to our room. Just excellent service. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: carryonOmaha
Reviews.Content: 10th floor suite was great view for us. The hotel staff were excellent. The valet were friendly and efficient. Perfect hotel to spend the weekend to see Radiohead and tour Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TiaOf3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed @ several Sprinhill Suites but none like this one! It is conveniently located to everything! No matter for what reason you are traveling! I have 3 girls and were going to Dallas for a trip to the zoo. Just 2 blocks from the hotel is the D.A.R.T. and that took us straight to the zoo! With gas prices so high, that was a big help. We also did the Dallas Aquarium and to my surprise, this hotel was just a very short block from that as well. Since it is on West End, it is very close to many restaurants. We had dinner @ the Spaghetti Warehouse, which was behind the hotel! Again, just a short walk. The beds were wonderful, the room was very spacious, breakfast was good. it was a very safe location, and above all the staff was awesome! Only downfall would have to be the pool. That was just a little too small. Other than that, I would recommend this location to every one coming down for a family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, good location, excellent people”
Reviews.Author: cew1137
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after leaving another hotel in Dallas. I stayed at this hotel for 19 nights total, and I don't regret a moment of it! The staff was amazing, especially Miss Gilda. She was so accomodating, and the nicest lady ever. They have free wireless internet in the rooms, free breakfast, and they had free happy hour with snacks on Monday-Wednesday. On Wednesday, they had karaoke. The room was so clean, as was the rest of the hotel. The location was good, near restaurants and bars. If I ever go back to Dallas, I will definitely stay here. I am quite picky when it comes to hotels, but this one was great!

Reviews.Title: “Springhill Suites Downtown”
Reviews.Author: pfatalbert
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for one night. The hotel is very nice, very clean, very modern. Friendly staff. They had karaoke and free beer on Wednesday nights! A very good time! Rooms were clean, fairly upscale. Bed was comfortable. Walls were a little thin though is my only complaint. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: Often_on_road
Reviews.Content: This hotel can best be summed up as a series of pluses and minuses. This hotel was in an excellent location in terms of local restaurants - a plus. In terms of proximity to the Convention Center, it was a good 15 minute walk and a $7.50 taxi ride back - a negative. The hotel had indicated on the phone that they had a free shuttle but it did not operate on the weekend. The room was large, well maintained, included a kitchen area/table and the wireless free -- big pluses. But, the room had a strange layout that included having the sink in the same area as the beds, meaning that turning on the light to use the sink disturbs any still sleeping. Further, the air conditioning was good but incredibly loud. The TV was relatively small and hard to see from one of the beds. The included breakfast buffet is very nice -- a plus and an excellent value, particularly for families. Except when the worker responsible does not show -- a negative. On the Saturday when the worker did not show, a staff member went out and bought about 200 take out egg sandwiches from McDonalds to put out -- OK but not a breakfast buffet. There is no manager's reception on the weekends. Staff ranged from very helpful and friendly -- a plus -- to rude and indifferent -- a negative. Sometimes, cheerful greeting. Sometimes, the front desk did not answer the phone and staff monitoring to ensure food did not run out at the buffet was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: modcon
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This was a great experience. The rooms were clean, large and comfortable. I can honestly say I haven't stayed in a nicer budget style suite hotel. Plenty of towels and quick response to requests. The staff was efficient and VERY friendly. They had a free wine/beer hour every night, as well as a karaoke night while we were there (which turned out to be a lot of fun!) The included buffet breakfast was fresh, hot and well tended in a clean, area with pleanty of tables (an unusual situation with this type of breakfast.) And the selection had something for every taste. Parking is an issue - as it is in any downtown area. You can pay $20/day for valet parking with unlimited in and out service (and they are very quick with the cars - and careful about parking them - no door dings!). Or you can park it yourself in the garage or lot across the street and pay each time you pull into the lot. Which you choose will depend on how long your stay will be and how often you plan on moving your car. We stayed for two nights to attend a concert at the American Airlines Center. This hotel was within walking distance. The West End has not fared very well the last few years, but it still has some decent restaurants and there is a whole group of new places opening around the West End proper. Highly recommended if you are attending any events near the West End.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Exactly What Was Expected”
Reviews.Author: CJKatl
Reviews.Content: This hotel delivered pretty much everything one should expect in a Springhill Suites. The furniture in the room is not the current, modern furniture, but it was clean, comfortable, and adequate. The bedding is the upgraded Springhill Suites sheets and mattress, which is good. The breakfast was actually a tad better than most, and the hotel was quiet. The valet parking was pricey, but the attendants were helpful. Same for the desk clerks, who allowed me a very late check-out. Cheerfully. The location was great. I woke up early and took a walk through downtown Dallas and the West End. Later, I walked to my meeting at the Adam's Mark. I also needed to buy a new razor, so the drug stor across the street was a big plus. And there were several restaurants within short walking distance. If business takes me back to downtown Dallas, I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Area is going downhill, but hotel is fine.”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoWanders
Reviews.Content: The staff were really nice and let me check-in very early. The WestEnd Marketplace has closed so it feels like the area is dying. Although, the Aquarium is extremely close by. During lunch the area felt safe and hopping, but at night (mid-week) it was not too fun. My room was pretty nice, but not outstanding. I liked the mini-fridge and the white duvet cover. The shower was dark and the towels were thin. My room was not very quiet, but it was right by the elevator (which I had requested to be away from). Overall the stay was fine, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta love the West End”
Reviews.Author: poodleone
Reviews.Content: We hadn't stayed since it changed over from Amerisuites to Mariott. Can't see much difference- beds are great, rooms are standard, location is spot on. The desk staff let us check in at 1030! We were meeting folks from out of town and we all agreed that the desk staff and valet were very accomodating. Funny thing- there were actually people in the outdoor pool on a night when it was 30 degrees and below- BRRRRRR! Our friends said the breakfast was fine- especially after coming in on the red eye from Seattle. We like it there- will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lostboydp
Reviews.Content: The main reason I chose this hotel is the location in the West End area. It was central to all the places I wanted to go that weekend. The room was very nice....kitchenette area with microwave and mini-fridge, living room area (coach, chair and coffee table), bedroom and bath. They have a great complimentary breakfast....scrambled eggs, sausage, make your own waffles, cereal, fruit and more. There's even a computer for use in the lounge area by the breakfast tables. The staff was friendly and helpful with directions. My only complaint is the loud air conditioner. It's the same as I had in a Springhill Suites in Rockville, MD last summer. It's so loud I had trouble sleeping. So, the second day I turned it all the way up during the day, and shut it off at night. But, for the convenient location and breakfast, it's pretty good. I'm going back this weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am here right now and the room is very large, like a small apartment, and the decor is very nice. It is one of the cleaner places I have stayed in a long while. It is worth the stay. Yeah, the parking is across the street if you choose self parking, but the valet parking is a lot more accessible. Besides, if you come and go a lot during the day, the cost is pretty much the same. As for the amenities - the bed is large and has a very comfortable duvet. The kitchenette has a microwave and refrigerator. The coffee machine comes with Maxell House coffee and Lipton Tea. The living space has a full sized sofa, coffee table, lamp and desk with FREE high-speed internet service. The bathroom is clean and modern. As for the staff, they have been great. Very nice and helpful. The location is within walking distance of many brand name restaurants and easy access to the highway. I would surely recommend this hotel. The only issue I would have is the drive through to the registration area. It is not well marked and hard to find. Bascally, it is right across the street from the Star Parking lot. I would suggest that you park there if you plan on doing self parking and simply walk acroos to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: ginger2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2005 with our 200 plus group of band students. Considering we had 200 plus, the hotel staff was very gracious to us. The breakfast buffet was nice, the rooms were clean - no mold in the bathroom - and the location is awesome. We got to Six Flags in 20 minutes and Medieval Times in 5. Dealy Plaza is about 4 blocks and easily within walking distance. There are so many restaurants within one block that it's hard to choose. The hotel will give you coupons to the restaurants as well. The only downside was that there were only two working elevators and the stairs could only be used for emergencies. They were not in the lobby either. All in all though, we had a very nice experience here. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Welshboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Amerisuites in September 2004 for a few nights. Great West-end location, it's like a village atmosphere in the area with plenty of restaurants and some bars. Found the hotel to be clean. The room was large (being a suite of sorts) with a kitchenette that had a microwave and coffee maker, decent bathroom and good sized comfortable bed. Only down side - unfortunately, there was no kettle in the kitchenette so boiling water had to be done in the cup in the microwave. Breakfast was very good with a selection of cereals, bagels, pastries, fruit, french toast, (American style) sausage and eggs from a buffet. Found the staff to be helpful & polite.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but probably will not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and so was the hotel staff. The location was good for west end activities. Slept very well, good matress. I could have done without the hassel of parking though. I arrived back at the hotel after a concert late (around 1:30am, paid $5.00 to park across the street and then left at eleven the next morning to find out that the $5.00 I paid the night before was only good until 6am so I had to pay another $5.00. I should have stayed at the Bradford Homesuites where I had origionally planned. Cheaper and has their own parking and not too far away.

HotelInfo.Name: Springhill Suites Dallas Downtown West End
HotelInfo.Address: 1907 North Lamar Street, Dallas, TX 75202
